Trade/Device Name(s): ePlex Blood Culture Identification Gram-Negative (BCID-GN) Panel
Regulation Name(s): Multiplex Nucleic Acid Assay For Identification Of Microorganisms And Resistance Markers From Positive Blood Cultures
Multiplex nucleic acid assay for identification of microorganisms and resistance markers from positive blood cultures
Analyte(s): OXA (blaOXA, OXA-23 and OXA-48 groups only)
Pan Gram-Positive assay (Bacillus cereus group, Bacillus subtilis group, Enterococcus, Staphylococcus, Streptococcus)
Pan Candida assay (Candida albicans, Candida glabrata, Candida krusei, Candida parapsilosis)
Specimen Type(s): Positive blood culture (from blood culture bottle)
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for ePlex Blood Culture Identification Gram-Negative (BCID-GN) Panel, a multiplex qualitative nucleic acid assay for detection and identification of gram-negative bacteria, select resistance genes, and some gram-positive and Candida species from positive blood cultures.
Indications for Use Summary: Qualitative multiplex in vitro diagnostic test for use on the ePlex Instrument to simultaneously detect and identify multiple gram-negative bacteria, antimicrobial resistance genes, certain gram-positive bacteria, and Candida species directly from positive blood culture bottles for diagnosis and management of bloodstream infections, used in conjunction with clinical assessment and other laboratory findings.
